'''''Cram''''' was a biscuit-like substance<ref name="Home">{{H|Home}}</ref> made by the [[Men of Dale]]<ref name="Farewell">{{FR|Farewell}}, p. 369</ref> and the [[Lake-men]]<ref name="Home" />. It was said to be nutritious, and was used as sustenance on long journeys, as it was by [[Thorin and Company]] on the last stage of their [[Quest for Erebor|quest]].<ref name="Home" /> When [[Gimli]] first saw a ''[[lembas]]'' cake, he looked at it with a doubtful expression and thought that it was ''cram'', but when he tasted a bit, he ate the whole cake with relish.<ref name="Farewell" />

Basic ''cram'' was a biscuitish, flavourless, uninspiring food.<ref name="Home" />. It was made of compressed flour, but sometimes milk and honey was added to it to make it more palatable.<ref name="LR">{{LR|Etymologies}}, base '''KRAB-''', p. 365</ref>

In the fictitious poem ''[[Perry-the-Winkle]]'', written by [[Samwise Gamgee]],<ref>{{AB|Preface}}</ref> the [[Lonely Troll]] fed [[Perry-the-Winkle (hobbit)|Perry]] "cramsome bread" and "cram-some cake".<ref name="Perry">{{AB|8}}</ref><ref name="RC">{{HM|RC}}, p. 328</ref>

==Etymology==
''Cram'' is probably a word in a [[Mannish]] language.<ref name="Cram">{{HH|While}}, (iii) ''A Note on Cram''</ref>

The Oxford English Dictionary contains the word "cram-cake", which means a "fried-cake" or "pancake".<ref name="RC" />

==Other versions of the legendarium==
In ''[[The Etymologies]]'', ''cram'' is said to be a [[Noldorin]] word (the precursor of [[Sindarin]]), from a root (KRAB-) meaning "press".<ref name="LR" /> This entry seems to have been added in late [[1937]] or early [[1938]].<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, introduction, p. 382</ref>

An earlier manuscript version of what would later become the chapter "[[A Knife in the Dark]]" mentions that ''[[Cram]]'' was "a word in the [[language of Dale|language]] of the men of Dale and the Long-lake".<ref>{{RS|Attack}}, p. 177</ref> This version seems to have been written before late summer 1938.<ref>{{RS|Rivendell}}, p. 214</ref> In the final published version of the chapter "[[Farewell to Lórien]]", [[Gimli]] says after trying ''[[lembas]]'' that he "thought it was only a kind of ''cram''" which the Dale-men would make for travel.<ref name="Farewell" />
